results.title: The Hitman
results.creator_credit: Tung Wai, Gordon Chan and China Star HK Distribution Ltd
results.brief_description: Following the assassination of a top Japanese Yakuza boss in Hong Kong, the most skilled hitmen assemble at a meeting held by the administrators of the dead man’s Revenge Fund, which promises $100 million for the head of the killer. One hopeful yet good-hearted hitman is Fu, a pennyless mainlander who accidentally walks into the meeting and is adopted by Ngok Lo, a con man agent for professional hitmen. Ngok Lo buys Fu new clothes and coaches him in the Hong Kong ways, proposing that Fu help him track down the killer so they can claim the bounty. In Cantonese with English subtitles. Cast includes: Jet Li, Eric Tsang, Simon Yam, Gigi Leung and Keiji Sato.

group_works.title: How to prepare your home for sale
group_works.creator_credit: Tim Counihan, Sarah Tringas and Moviemaster

results.title: The Home buyers' bible
results.brief_description: Don’t be trapped when buying a home. Designed to prepare you for what will quite possibly be the most important purchase of your life. It prepares you with the information needed to protect yourself from problems whan buying a home, whilst also supplying information about what to do and where to go should you encounter difficulties after purchasing a home.

results.title: The City and it's regions
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
History shows that cities thrive best when they live in harmony and balance with the countryside around them. The film asks how this balance can be maintained or restored in today’s sprawling metropolitan regions.

results.title: Lewis Mumford on the city
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This series illustrates what Mumford first explained in his celebrated book ‘The City in History : its origins, its transformation and its prospects’. These films comprise an engrossing study of the city as it once was, the city as we know it now and the city as it may be if it survives the dangers which Mr. Mumford points out on the screen. Filmed in eleven countries, a master view is presented of the city, and the glories of city life with the achievements, failures and promises of our urban culture made plain. Throughout the films you feel the warm attachment to cities which underlies Mr. Mumford’s conviction that “the city is man’s most precious collective invention”. He asks and tries to answer: What has the city done to ennoble man in the past? What is it doing now to rob him of rewards that urban life should give him? Challenges all concerned about the way we live and about the legacy we leave to our children.

results.title: The City and the future
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
Today an urgent choice must be made - an urban sprawl or a new kind of regional city. Examines prospects for the city and ways to restore its role as the focus of man’s highest achievement

results.title: The City as man's home
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
Slums, giant public housing complexes, mass suburbs, anonymous and bleak luxury apartments - almost everywhere in cities communal standards of living are falling even as personal standards of living rise. How did this happen and what can our cities do to improve communal living standards? These problems are discussed and fully illustrated.

results.title: The History of the Luftwaffe
results.brief_description: After the skirmishes of WW1 armed forces fought each other in the skies for the first time, and soon planes would presage every role of future armies and navies. Upon losing the war, the size of the German armed forces was restricted, to ensure that Germany did not become a military threat in Europe. In the 1920s the desire for new technology and military designs was urgent, and following Hitler’s rise to power in the 1930s, much of the research and development was conducted clandestinely. Despite restrictions, a massive and formidable air force - The Luftwaffe - was born, and Germany’s armed forces burgeoned. This documentary uses extensive archival footage, much of it recently recovered from the East and viewed for the first time, to display these weapons of war. The role of Hitler and Hermann Goering is discussed at length, as these two warmongers contributed to the fortunes of the Luftawaffe throughout WW2. Features extensive and fascinating black and white footage of Europe from the 1910s, 20s, 30s and 40s, showing the incredible devastation of war on the land and people. Aeroplane enthusiasts, and particularly those interested in war planes, should enjoy the historical visuals and informative narrative of the various planes of the Luftwaffe.
